item.title: Sadie add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "The wound is the place where the Light enters you." -- Rumi

item.title: Sadie add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Let yourself be drawn by the stronger pull of that which you truly love." -- Rumi

item.title: Sadie add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Start a huge, foolish project, like Noah…it makes absolutely no difference what people think of you." -- Rumi

item.title: Sadie add a quote by Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
item.description: "Everything in the universe is within you. Ask all from yourself." -- Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

item.title: Sadie add a quote by Jelalludin Rumi
item.description:
"Today, like every other day, we wake up empty and frightened. Don't open the door to the study and begin reading. Take down the dulcimer.
Let the beauty we love be what we do. There are hundreds of ways to kneel and kiss the ground." -- Jelalludin Rumi

item.title: Sadie add a quote by Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
item.description: "You must ask for what you really want. / Don't go back to sleep. / The door is round and open. / Don't go back to sleep." -- Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

item.title: Sadie add a quote by Rumi Jalalu'l-Din
item.description: "Keep your intelligence white hot and your grief glistening“ so your life will stay fresh." -- Rumi Jalalu'l-Din

item.title: Sadie add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "The breeze at dawn has secrets to tell you. Don't go back to sleep." -- Rumi

item.title: Sadie add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Work on your strong qualities and become resplendent like the ruby. Practice self-denial and accept difficulty. Always see infinite life in letting the self die. Your stoniness will decrease; your ruby nature will grow. The signs of self-existence will leave your body, and ecstasy will take you over." -- Rumi

item.title: Sadie add a quote by Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
item.description: "Thankfulness brings you to the place where the Beloved lives." -- Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

item.title: Sadie add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face. You are able to say to yourself, 'I have lived through this horror. I can take the next thing that comes along.' You must do the thing you think you cannot do." -- Eleanor Roosevelt
